reviews.review: This game was recommended to me by a good friend of mine in the awakening of my gaming experience. Having only known games where I was in complete control, I went into Portal hoping to be challenged. I was not disappointed. I first opened up this game while I was in the midst of a panic attack during a power outage in my house and I was immediately calmed down. Portal provided the perfect distraction with their somewhat ruthless robot lady friend, GLaDOS, whom I enjoyed dearly and excellent game design. The chambers (puzzles, in this case) were not extremely difficult to tackle so I was able to get a hang of it fairly quick. My only recommendation is to play through the whole game again after you've got the gist of each chamber and the final "boss" showdown because the dialogue is exquisite. Personally, I've gone back in many times to try and earn all of the achievements, which has made the experience with this game even better for me. For the TL;DR people who still have not bought this game: Buy it. It's so worth it.

This game is obviously a classic and is definitely good, but wow, is it short. Really short. I completed it in one setting; just under two and a half hours. I've never played either Portal game before. And I was taking my time, exploring all the little side areas, reading the posters on the wall, watching the powerpoint presentations, etc. I even watched the code scroll by on one of the computers in a side room (sure enough, there was some cheeky stuff in there, lol.)
Two and a half hours. I almost could have refunded it! :/

I don't fault the game for being short; I think it was more of a tech demo in its day. But today they're selling it for $9.99 and the description says the game "will offer gamers hours of unique gameplay."
That's definitely a stretch and is the bit that miffs me.

Portal is a relatively short game revolving around the use of 2 different colour portals and real-life physics. I don't know why I explained that since EVERYONE knows about portal. It's funny, dark, clever and just a down right simple game. Even though it is only 2-3 hrs long that amount of time is enough to fully appreciate the game. There are also some extra maps for those who want a challenge. 12 years after its release, I'm happy I decided to play Portal.

No bugs. Loading times are a bit long. Achievement's are a pain. Cameras in the main game are simple enough but the hidden transmissions are just  -_-
Advanced maps are a nice challenge. The time trials and least steps maps will make you want to kill yourself's- Enjoy :)

夏促V包入，花了大概六个小时不看攻略通关，不禁感叹这个游戏的超前性（发行时我才七岁），结尾居然还有首歌，我猜GLaDOS才是真·主角吧。

虽然看上去是解密3D小游戏，但是即便是在发行12年后的今天玩起来仍然领先于大部分同行。后半段跑路的剧情脑洞打开，卡关一个多小时后摸索出解决方案总有「woc这都行」的感慨。炮台关卡出现后，随处都有的小房间里的彩蛋也能组成一个完美的剧情，给这个游戏安上了非常合理的故事，非常令人惊叹。

二刷的时候开了讲解模式，刚进游戏就听到了那个偷走我钱包的男人充满磁性的嗓音。感谢G胖和Valve，能做出这么好的游戏，还能打折一起卖。夏促V包真的是世界上性价比最高的东西之一了。

I finally got around to playing this classic. It's a must-play.

[h1]Pros[/h1]
[list]
[*]Two-way portal system and physics make for an incredibly unique puzzle experience
[*]Short, but concise (took me ~4 hrs to complete)
[*]Easter eggs add backstory for the interested explorer
[*]Script and voice acting
[*]Bonus levels
[*]Price point (check out the bundle)
[/list]

[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]Menu design
[*]Load times
[/list]

Portal is a highly original puzzle game that combines an interesting concept (the portal gun) with an equally interesting antagonist. Its well worth playing this game before you move on to Portal 2 (the better game) as it does have its moments, however if you can only get one then get Portal 2. This game introduces you nice and slowly into thinking with portals whilst slowly increasing in complexity (all whilst being taunted). I wouldn't call this a must play, but its well worth trying.
It's sooo good.
The cake is NOT a lie!!

Play before Portal 2 if you can, both are fantastic but would suggest it works better (Portal is less difficult) playing in order.

I'd still highly recommend Portal to anyone though, even in 2019. Fantastic game.

Ya que estás te compras el Bundle con la secuela - que es más mejor y mejor más en todo lo bueno que se puede decir de este juego -, y así te ahorras unos dineros.

One of the most famous puzzle games in history, really challenging and complicated, with a Valve style from beginning to end, both for good and for bad; I personally don't like so much simplicity in the movements and effects, but it is a matter of opinions.

It is a casual game, to play from time to time in the dead times, since it does not have a story that catches you, only the challenge of the levels, which makes it not a game for everyone.

Without a doubt, with a good offer it is a must-play, just for its fame.
Despite it's length, Portal is a really fun game. As it stands as 10 bucks right now I'd say it's worth a buy.

its an awesome game, i hope that there's a portal 2 soon i'm waiting for it... and the ending was hilarious.
Great game that is probably one of the best games ever made. A must play.

If you haven't played any of the portal games, pick up the second game since it have the same price, but it contains the steam workshop that you can spend hundreds of hours playing and creating levels. (If you really wants to start off portal 1, I strongly recommend the Orange Box because ALL games in it are very worth playing)

But

If you owned this game and want to decide whether this game worth your time playing, it is always a yes.

Personally I really like this game, but for some reason during the Escape levels after Chamber 19, I often fell disgusted by the lighting and the art style of that level, which doesn't makes me feel good.

Puzzle wise the base game isn't too difficult, but thinking is still required. DO NOT expect this as a type of game for relaxing after a day of school or work. You are going to use your brain to play this.

The advance Chamber is a little more challenging then the normal chamber but the Challenges (least steps, least portals or least time) are really difficult. (especially the least time, it is always a pain in the a**)

For achievements hunter, all 15 game achievements can all be achieved solo, and it cost me 16.8h to achieve all of them.

Generally, if you beat the base game, the challenges and the advance chamber, there is not a lot left to do. You can still rebeat the base game since it have some sort of replay ability (but not much), but other then that, just go play Portal 2 if you enjoy since you can play all sorts of levels from the workshop and even create your own level.
Get on this bandwagon.

Comparado ao segundo jogo, Portal 1 é bem curto e menos elaborado em alguns aspectos mas ainda assim muito bom e gostoso de se jogar, os desafios são medianos, não precisa ser um gênio cientista para conclui-los mas além da jogabilidade e mecânicas espetaculares, outro ponto alto pra mim é a Glados e seus comentários maravilhosos sobre sua evolução dentro das câmaras de teste, sim porque é isso que você é dentro do jogo, uma cobaia de testes e sim o jogo tem uma história maravilhosa criada dentro de um ambiente de testes focado quase que exclusivamente em puzzles e sim, Portal 2 é divino e perfeito e deveria existir um portal 3 apesar de ter vários mapas criados pela comunidade para o jogo, mas ainda assim deveria sair um portal 3 urgente!!!

[h1]Nota: 9/10[/h1] - campanha curta mas humor negro genial em um dos melhores jogos de puzzles já criados.
